statement:
Let $\omega_0$ and $\omega_1$ be symplectic structures on a compact
manifold $M$. If there is a path in the space of symplectic structures
of a fixed DeRham cohomology class connecting ${\omega}_0$ and
${\omega}_1$ (in particular ${\omega}_0$ and ${\omega}_1$ must have the
same class), then $(M,\omega_0)$ and $(M,\omega_1)$ are
symplectomorphic, by a symplectomorphism isotopic to the identity.
